query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Plan for Dissemination and Outreach of Results (PDOR)
result.description: Full title:Plan for Dissemination and Outreach of Results (PDOR).Co-lead:EcoU will co-lead this deliverable.Updates:Updated versions of the PDOR will be prepared by M12, M24, and M36.Aim:To make explicit and help monitor the dissemination, outreach and exploitation of results as indicated in section 2.2 and Table 2.3 in Part B of DoA. Indicator of success/failure:Generation of the PDOR and its ability to meet the kinds of indicators of success established in Table 2.3. relevant for supporting the emergence of positive SETPs in CCIRs.

result.title: WP5 Literature Review
result.description: Full title:Literature review advancing the state of the art on the characterisation of social-ecological regional energy systems.Co-lead:PUO will co-lead this deliverable.Aim:To identify the latest and most relevant research findings on regional studies research literature using a systems approach relevant for the understanding of SETPs in CCIRs; and integrate these findings to elaborate the case studies Guidelines and support the Integration Framework. Indicator of success/failure:Identification of key variables affecting SETPs according to regional systems studies and their inclusion and relevance for carrying out the project regional case studies.

result.title: WP4 Case Study
result.description: Full title:WP4 case study with special emphasis on macro-economic factors and indicators.Aim:To provide an exemplary case study to illustrate the relevance of the selected factors in Economics to understand cumulative processes, capacities and socio-structural forces in CCIRs that lead to positive or negative SETPs for regional energy transitions; and feed case studies guidelines and integration framework. Indicator of success/failure:Completion of case study and integration in WP5 key regional findings analysis.

result.title: New social theory in SETPs in CCIRs and Integration Framework
result.description: Full title:New social theory on SETPs in CCIRs including the overall project knowledge Integration FrameworkAim:To generate a step-wise scientific advance from social sciences for the understanding of SETPs in energy transitions in CCIR in the form an empirically grounded novel Social Theory (ST) integrating all deductive and inductive findings of the project. Indicator of success/failure:Publication of the new ST in an international peer-reviewed scientific journal.

result.title: Case Study Key Findings
result.description: Full title:Summary report with key findings of the 20 regional case studies.Co-lead:IBS will co-lead this deliverable.Aim:Based on the merging of indicators sets from WPs1-4, this deliverable will provide a summary analysis of the key findings of the 20 case studies including the key narratives that potentially foster the emergence of transformative capacities in CCIRs. Indicator of success/failure: Scientific and policy relevant guidelines for identifying SETPs in CCIRs and summary report with key findings from the 20 case studies.

result.title: Set of Policy briefs
result.description: Full title:Set of Policy briefs.Co-lead:UPRC will co-lead this deliverable.Aim:To provide specially targeted policy and stakeholder briefs in easy and accessible language derived from key finding from WPs1-4 and of the metanalysis of the case studies and to be used in dissemination, outreach and exploitation activities. Indicator of success/failure:Production of five policy briefs, number of downloads and use in dissemination, outreach and exploitation activities.

result.title: Policy brief with recommendations on SETPs
result.description: Full title:Policy brief with recommendations on SETPs to accelerate low-carbon, clean energy transitions in CCIRsAim: To provide in plain, strategic and accessible language and in the form of a policy brief the key recommendations stemming from WP7 integration to be used in dissemination, outreaching and exploitation project activities. Indicator of success/failure:Production of policy brief, downloads and use in dissemination, outreaching and exploitation project activities.

result.title: Report on the autonomous and externally controllable MC system for the management of GBM
result.description: Asses and verify viability, stability, sustainability, effectiveness and robustness of the various system components with measurements of T5.1. Use the data to compare the optimal signal power vs the concentration of released EXs, and its impact on treatment and monitoring, serving to validate theoretical models of WP3 and the algorithms of T4.1.

result.title: Initial market analysis
result.description: This initial deliverable addresses an analysis of barriers to the market for the three target sectors ie bivalve mariculture oysterground restoration and wild fisheries the sustainability of the service and the impact of no longer having access to free data provided by the EU task 61 In D61 the market barrier will be addressed such as the scale of the market the positioning in the market the product differentiation and the strength of potential competitors the capital requirement for keeping in the market after EU funding the government policy for example licensing requirements competition agreements

result.title: Policy recommendations (European Level)
result.description: At European level, a set of policy recommendations will be developed with a focus on how to drive the transition to clean energy for Europeâ€™s coal and carbon-intensive regions with an overall European perspective. Such recommendations will be addressed mainly to EU policy makers, but also to European networks and stakeholders, as well as to national government representatives.

result.title: Plan for the exploitation, dissemination and communication of the projectâ€™s results (PEDR)
result.description: A PEDR will be developed at the beginning of the project closely aligned with the activities of the other WPs and on the basis of what already outlined in the Section 221 It will include detailed information on the objectives target stakeholder groups messages that will be communicated to these groups the channels and tools to be used and a tentative timeline of implementation It will be updated at Month 20
